field_edited_text.value:
D. REQUIREMENTS



1. The Developer shall provide and maintain a public upper-level
walkway to connect with the Hopkins Place overpass and with
the upper-level platform south of Baltimore Street in Area 14
(both of which will be built by the City and can be identified on
page 4 in accordance with the following:

a.

That portion of the upper-level walkway which is to be
constructed above Area 14 shall be of cantilevered con-
struction in a minimum width of 15 feet and shall have a
surface elevation of 59't., The walkway shall be designed
to connect with the upper-level platform in Area 14, and

with the elevator from the garage in Area 14, both as

shown on the ''Site Definition'' drawing on page 10, and it
shall include, at Developer's cost, the provision of soffit
lighting with conduit in the underside, in accordance with
Charles Center Standards. The conduit for the lighting
may be connected to a City service, in the Area of the el-
evator shaft in Area 14.

That portion of the upper-level walkway which is to be
constructed in areas '""D" and "E'" shall have a minimum
width of 15 feet and a surface elevation of 59't. It shall
be designed to provide a suitable termination for the Hop-
kins Place public pedestrian overpass and shall connect
with the overpass at the division line between''C' and ''D",
as shown on the Site Definition. All necessary supports
and connections for the east end of the Hopkins Place over-
pass, whether in area '""C', "D", or "E', shall be built
and maintained by the Developer. The design of such sup-
ports shall conform to the design of the Hopkins Place
overpass. Soffit lighting with conduit for this portion of
the upper level walkway shall be provided by the Developer,
at his cost, in accordance with Charles Center Standards,
but the conduit for the lighting may be connected to a City

service, in the area of the elevator shaft in Area 14.

The walkway shall contain a stair near its western end in
Area '""D" and/or "E'" connecting the walkway with ground
level. The stair will be in a minimum clear width of 6
feet with a riser/tread relationship suitable for regular
outdoor public use.

The entire upper level walkway shall be designed so as to
conform toCharles Center standards for upper level walk-
ways (e. g. a 24 inch construction depth, a railing which is
not opaque, and a surface of exposed limestone aggregate
concrete).

12

"3 ’g.
